metadata.title: CVE-2024-36976 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Compliant (xenial) - medium
metadata.description:
In the Linux kernel, the following vulnerability has been resolved: Revert"media: v4l2-ctrls: show all owned controls in log_status" This revertscommit 9801b5b28c6929139d6fceeee8d739cc67bb2739. This patch introduced apotential deadlock scenario: [Wed May 8 10:02:06 2024] Possible unsafelocking scenario: [Wed May 8 10:02:06 2024] CPU0 CPU1 [Wed May 8 10:02:062024] ---- ---- [Wed May 8 10:02:06 2024]lock(vivid_ctrls:1620:(hdl_vid_cap)->_lock); [Wed May 8 10:02:06 2024]lock(vivid_ctrls:1608:(hdl_user_vid)->_lock); [Wed May 8 10:02:06 2024]lock(vivid_ctrls:1620:(hdl_vid_cap)->_lock); [Wed May 8 10:02:06 2024]lock(vivid_ctrls:1608:(hdl_user_vid)->_lock); For now just revert.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2024-36976` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.4.0-1003-fips - 4.4.0-1098.105
linux-image-extra-4.4.0-1003-fips - 4.4.0-1098.105
linux-image-hmac-4.4.0-1003-fips - 4.4.0-1098.105
Available with Ubuntu Pro: https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: linux-fips package in fips-updates/xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1098.105').
